alert.note: Alert for Pima; Pinal (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 21 at 9:57PM MST until August 21 at 11:15PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tucson has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Northwestern Pima County in southeastern Arizona... Southwestern Pinal County in southeastern Arizona... * Until 1115 PM MST. * At 957 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated that thunderstorms had produced very heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain has fallen north of Santa Rosa along route 15 and route 42. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks, streams and highways. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Santa Rosa, Anegam, North Komelik, Kohatk, Palo Verde Stand, Ventana, Vaya Chin, Jack Rabbit, San Luis and Santa Rosa School. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
